result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy Joan Zahurones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court calls 15CF115, 15CF125 & 15CF197  @ 11:23 am. Defendant Amy Joan Zahurones in court with attorney Megan Sanders-Drazen.  Defendant Amy Joan Zahurones in custody and via-video.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion filed for sentence credit.  Court has reviewed brief. State has only issue on 15CF115 Ct 2 and doesn't agree on sentence credit and gives argument.  Atty Sanders-Drazen gives argument.  Respond by State. Rebuttal by Atty Sanders-Drazen. Court covers some issues, Atty's agree to credit on 15CF115 Ct's 1 3 & 5, 276 days credit, 15CF125 Ct 1 340 days credit, 15CF197 Ct's 2 & 3  272 days credit.  16CF131 Mute point, Court not granting any credit or adjusting at this time.  Court gives ruling on 15CF115 Ct 2. Court denies credit on Ct. 2. Court will grant additional 4 days credit. Atty Sanders-Drazen heard on stay sentence pending appeal, and gives argument. State request Court to deny request. Court will grant defense motion to stay sentence 15CF115 on Ct 2 pending appeal defendant will need to complete other sentence.  State replys.  Remaining sentence on Ct 2 will be stayed. State heard on bond.  Court orders on ct 2 $5,000 Signature w/conditions. Atty Sanders-Drazen will file order on appeal.  Def. makes statement.  Atty Sanders-Drazen will take bond to get def signature.
Def's NOH
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on August 22, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Amy Joan Zahurones in court with attorney Andrew W. Boden.  Defendant Amy Joan Zahurones in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF115, 15CF125, 15CF197 and 16CF131 @ 9:05 a.m. Agreement reached - Revocation packet received by State, no additions or corrections. Credit stated 15CF115 - 285 days. 15CF125 - 337 days. 15CF197 - 264 days. 16CF131 - no credit.
16CF131 - State moves to dri ct 2, Def will plead to ct 1 misd theft as repeater. 15CF115 cts 1, 3 & 5 - adopt DOC recommendation, ct 1 - 30 days jail, ct 3 - 30 days jail, ct 5 - 9 mo jail, all concurrent. Ct 2 - DEJ will be revoked, prison 2 yrs ic, 2 yrs es, concurrent to any other. 16CF131 ct 1 - prison, 12 mo ic, 6 mo es, concurrent to any other. 15CF125 - follow DOC recommendation ct 1 - 3 yrs prison, 18 mo ic, 18 mo es, concurrent to any other. 15CF197 ct 2 - 1 yr jail, concurrent to any, ct 3 - 3 yrs prison, 18 mo ic, 18 mo es. Will leave to court issue of costs.  16CF131 State has complied with VWNR.  Restitution requested $69.99. State does not object to Def requesting rest. hrg. Response by Atty Boden, believes agreement was 15CF115 DEJ revocation was going to be argued. Response by State. Court asks for brief statement of argument. Statement by Atty Boden. Parties agree to argue DEJ. Atty Boden has received revocation packet, no corrections.
16CF131 - Court reviews plea quest. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 2. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Boden satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 misd theft as repeater. Sentencing remarks and arguments by State. Sentencing arguments by Atty Boden. Statement by Defendant. Recess 9:58 Resume 10:01.
Sentencing remarks by the Court. 16CF131 ct 1 - 12 months jail, court costs, DNA surcharge, $69.99 restitution, no credit for time served. 15CF115 ct 1 - 30 days jail, ct 3 - 30 days jail, ct 5 - 9 months jail, all concurrent to each other and to 16CF131. Convert outstanding court obligations to civil judgment. Credit for 285 days served. Sentences completed. Ct 2 - This is controlling sentence. 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs initial conf. 2 yrs ext supv. Court costs, DNA surcharge. No credit for time served, reserves right for Atty Boden to address credit applying to this ct. 15CF125 ct 1 - 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs initial, 2 yrs ext supv, credit for 337 days served. Concurrent to all other sentences today. Convert oblitgations to civil judgment. 15CF197 ct 2 - 12 months jail, civil judgment on both cts. Credit for 264 days. Ct 3 - 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs initial, 2 yrs ext supv. Credit for 264. If credit of 285 given on ct 2 of 15CF115 then this will be controlling sentence. Def eligible for earned release and challenge inc. programs. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Postconviction rights. 16CF131 - pmt plan upon release. All sentences concurrent. (S.D. advised DNA already on file)  (Reviewed with Judge, cost & restitution on 16CF131 to be collected by DOC as part of judgment on 15CF115, Ct 2 )
Revocation Packet

Defendant Amy Joan Zahurones in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Amy Joan Zahurones in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF115 and 15CF125 @ 10:52 a.m. Agreement 15CF115 - plea to cts 1, 2, 3 & 5, dismiss and read in cts 4 & 6. Ct 2 defer judgment 2 yrs., conditions successfully complete probation, cooperate with soc services, pay all court obligations, no new crimes to pc, will dismiss. Cts 1,3, & 5 withheld sentence on each, 2 yrs probation, concurrent, AODA and follow through, counseling deemed appropriate, cooperate with soc services, court costs. 15CF125 - plea to ct 1,  dismiss and read in cts 2 & 3, withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, concurrent, counseling, court costs. Atty Laufenberg agrees. Def agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. 15CF115 ct 1 - no contest. Ct 2 - no contest plea. Ct 3 - no contest plea. Ct 5 - no contest plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in cts 4 & 6. 15CF125 ct 1 - no contest plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in cts 2 & 3. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. State has complied with victim notification requirements. Atty Laufenberg satisfied. Court finds pleas freely & voluntarily made with full understanding. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CF115 ct 1, ct 3, ct 5, 15CF125 ct 1. 15CF115 ct 2 - judgment deferred in accordance with agreement. Sentencing remarks by Counsel.  State asks for review hrg on 15CF115 ct 2 on 9/26/17 @ 1:00 p.m., asks bond applied to costs or returned to poster, 4 days credit if revoked. 15CF125 - 65 days credit if revoked.  Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. 15CF115 ct 1 - withheld prison sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow up, cooperate with Langlade Co. Social Services, court costs including DNA surcharge, DNA sample, credit for 4 days served if revoked. Apply bond to costs. Ct 2 - deferred judgment agreement approved, if cooperates with Soc Serv, no crimes, obligations paid and completes probation, will dismiss. Ct 3 - withheld prison sentence, 2 yrs probation, concurrent with ct 1 and same conditions. Ct 5 - withheld prison sentence, 2 yrs probation, concurrent, same conditions. 15CF125 ct 1- withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, concurrent with15CF115, counseling as requested, court costs. Credit for 65 days if revoked. 15CF115 cts 1, 3, 5 DNA surcharge. 15CF125 DNA surcharge and sample. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. DNA colloquy. Postconviction rights. 15CF115 Court converts bond to $1,000.00 signature. Discussion regarding bond conditions.  Review hearing scheduled for September 26, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
of Preliminary Examination

Defendant Amy Joan Zahurones in court & in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF115 & 15CF125 @ 9:53 am.  15CF115 P.H. has already been waived.  Information Filed.  Atty Laufenberg has copy of information, waives reading, reserve rights, & enters Not Guilty plea. Court receives not guilty to all 6 ct's.  15CF125 Waiver of Preliminary Examination form filed. State needs to clarify in 15CF125 thinks p.h. already waived, & 15CF115 needs to waive ph. off the record, back on the record, Court clarifies in 15CF125 Def has already waived P.H. Information filed & pleas are already entered 7-22-15.  15CF115  Waiver of P.H. examination filed. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver. Information filed.  Atty Laufenberg has copy of information, waives reading, reserve rights & enters Not Guilty plea to 6 ct's.  Court receives not guilty plea to 6 ct's & directs clerk of enter plea.  Atty Laufenberg gives argument on bond in 15CF125.  State gives bond argument.  15CF115 100 cash bond posted on 7-6-15 & 7-18-15 arrested on 15CF125.  Atty Laufenberg replys. Judge gives decision on bond & denies signature bond but will reduce to 500 cash bond in 15CF125 same conditions.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 10:15 am.
